runs.comm: length ball outside the line of off, chopped square and fielded by a clutch of scuttling blue men
floated up nice and full, taken on the half volley and driven past the bowler for one to mid-on
round the wicket to the left-handed Rutherford, worked in front of midwicket
here we go, four balls in and the sightscreen has taken a rattle, Guptill charging out to smash a length ball over long-off. Get settled in for the bombardment
drags his length down, outside of and steered through the covers
worked off the pads into the square leg region
back of a length, on leg stump and worked with a flick of the wrists straight to backward square leg on the edge of the circle
angled across on a length outside off, steered into a gap towards point, they get one
pitched up in the corridor outside off, leans into a drive but picks out cover
touch shorter, wide of the stumps and this jumps to take the shoulder of the bat and run behind point
short and at the man, pulled with a roll of the wrists behind square on the leg side, there's some relay work in the deep to prevent a boundary

another bumper and Rutherford swipes at it, gets a huge top edge and the ball sails all the way, over the keeper and slips, rattling into the same sightscreen as Guptill smacked an over ago. Good grief!
on the stumps, gets forward to push into the off side
stays in the crease and steers one through point from outside off
length ball in the channel outside off, blocks on the front foot
short of a length, at the body, Rutherford tees off again and chips aerially over midwicket, it falls short of the man in the deep
beaten, good ball this from Finn, holding its line outside off as Guptill prodded his stick of rhubarb outside off
connect this time, skipping out to carve the ball on the up over cover, that nearly goes all the way too!
length ball on the stumps, pushed back down the pitch, beats Broad's grab and they steal one
outside the line of off, backs away and slaps a single through the covers
touch short and Rutherford throws the bat, there's a looping top edge out into the covers but the fielder can't get under it and the ball lands safely
angled across on a length, another hard slash and a thick outside edge flies to third man where Luke Wright, I think, makes a decent diving stop
stays in the crease and pushes back down the ground
pitched up and driven back, Broad dives to his left to take the pace off it
back of a length, this comes back a touch and surprises Guptill, catching the shoulder of the bat and rolling out towards point
on the body and turned through leg
takes the pace off this one, rolling his fingers over the ball, but Rutherford has his icecream scoop out and hoicks this over deep backward square leg with barely a flick
gets forward and taps into the off side, Morgan scurries across at cover but can't cut off one
well, that's going to have steam coming out of Finn's ears... a straight drive from Guptill, down the wrong line, ends up going for four, a massive outside edge soaring over point and gambolling away
nudged off the pads and there's room for them to run a quick, hard one
length ball outside off and lacerated through the covers, Guptill standing back and thrashing the ball from the crease practically through the diving fielder
touch shorter, steered down to third man
leg-stump line, goes back and works the ball off the hips
full and straight, punched down the ground for a single
ah ha, there's the Dernbach gambit, a slower ball that Rutherford doesn't pick, it's well directed and he has to pull out of his pre-meditated big heave to block
full and wide of the stumps, swings hard but drills the ball straight to point
short and wide to begin with, bit of a loosener but you don't get much room for those in this game and Guptil rattles a cut to the boundary
change of pace, on the stumps and drifting in, inside-edges the ball via the pad behind square
down the leg side, back of a length and it flips some material on the way through to Buttler, so not a wide
dug in at the body, nudged square on the leg side
length, on the pads, turned into a gap at backward square leg but a bit of hustle in the field prevents a second run
full and speared across the left-hander, driven with a wide arc of the bat for a single into the covers
over the wicket, tossed and played back down the track
floated up into the slot, this time he's not going to miss out and Rutherford launches another Dorothy straight down the ground
touch flatter, worked off the pads through square leg
round the wicket, shuffles across and clips to leg
tossed up and closes the face, takes another single into the square leg region
pitched up in the slot, bit of width and Rutherford cracks a drive through cover, not much footwork but plenty of timing and Popeye power

and then gone, just a tickle through to the keeper! Wright has made the breakthrough, Rutherford trying something a little more delicate, maybe a slightly slower ball that just gripped a little and the attempted glide to third man ended up as a gimme to Buttler
practically cut in half first ball! Bit of extra nip there from Wright, bringing a length ball back in, beating everything on its way through to the keeper
on the stumps, gets forward to push back to the bowler
again foxed by a bit of seam movement, a length ball angling back and jammed into the front pad along with a sliver of bat
full and angled towards leg stump, deflects away off the pad behind square
off the mark with a steer through midwicket
phew, just as I was threatening to start shivering with the effects of cold turkey, Guptill uppercuts a short, wide-ish ball for six to third man
angled in, touch short and at the body, worked to the fielder at midwicket
dug in short again, Guptill tries to turn to leg and the ball ricochets into the off side
stays back and blocks a short ball that angles back in from outside off
back of a length and rearing with a snort past the outside edge as McCullum dangles the bat - can't hit those for six
hangs back in the crease and tapes a length ball short of midwicket, excellent running gets them a second
tossed up and tickled between mid-on and midwicket
McCullum comes to the party and lets off a popper, striding down the wicket to spank Patel high, high over wide long-on and into the the crowd on the grass banks
tossed up and turned off the legs
leans round the front pad and works through midwicket
attacks again, on the walk but mistimes his heave and the ball drops on to the pitch as Buttler comes forward to collect
tossed up and pushed down the ground to long-off
on the stumps and defended
touch short, McCullum backs away and Babe Ruths the ball over deep midwicket with a crunching swing of the bat
full and wide of off and this time the batsman goes inside out, slashing over the covers, it's chased down before reaching the rope

scooped out towards deep backward square and Guptill perishes! Tredwell gave it some air, maintained his accuracy and Guptill went down on one knee, only to pick out the fielder on the rope three runs short of a fifty
flatter, spinning in a touch from outside off, tapped respectfully back down the track
full and wide of the stumps, steps away and swings the ball flat and low through the covers
length, on the stumps, worked back past Wright, who goes haring after it
punched back towards mid-off
worked into the leg side from in front of the stumps
takes the pace off, wicket to wicket, manages to squeeze it into the infield
shorter as carved on the up through backward point as Taylor comes dancing out
dug in, wide of the stumps and slashed high, off the edge but short of third man
length and in the channel, gets forward but can only steer straight to point
back of a length, soars through over the stumps as McCullum swings like a rusty gate
short but drifting towards leg stump and McCullum rolls the wrists and pulls fine of short fine leg, that will run away
further lassitude, basically a leg-stump long-hop and he gets on top of it to pull through deep backward square this time
that's three in a row, this time driven crisply through extra-cover, lovely timing from McCullum to dispatch a full ball for four more!

scooped high out towards the deep midwicket rope but that won't get there, even with the short boundary, Bairstow takes the catch! Wright has his second wicket, it was a length ball on the stumps, an ugly smear across the line by Taylor, who's still searching for form after his NZ return
back of a length, steered behind point from the crease
on the stumps, played back
full and straight and Munro opens the face to drive, picks out point
touch back of a length, goes back and pulls flat through mid-on to the man on the fence
edged, but wide of the keeper! Wright had McCullum in two minds, pushing only half forward and the snick runs fine enough to get four
down the leg side, that's a wide
good response from Dernbach, quicker ball angled across and beating the bat
goes back and manages to shovel the ball into the leg side, possibly off pad
slower ball, well directed, McCullum waits on it and nudges into the leg side
another out the back of the hand, cut off the back foot and Alex Hales does superbly to prevent four with a slide on the boundary
another outside edge brings four, Munro beaten for pace outside off but he got enough bat on it to get it a few yards wide of Buttler

this time he goes, slogging a slower ball to YJB at deep midwicket again! Dernbach took the pace off and Munro was slightly through the shot, trying to muller the ball over the ropes but picking out the man
goes back and uses the pace to get a couple wide of third man
bumper at the man, mistimes the pull shot and is hit on the body but it rolls away for a bye
dug in short and pulled like a rocket through backward square leg, another excellent diving stop prevents four - England doing good work in the field today
on the stumps, worked back down the ground towards long-on

cripes, get out of the way of that ... McCullum made room and detonated a flat pull straight back down the track, it exploded the stumps at the bowler's end and then almost ran away for four through extra-cover, such was the power, Broad doing well to fetch it back
full and straight and not far off hitting leg stump as McCullum swings with plenty of gusto but little success
takes the pace of, pulled and it comes off the toe of the bat, short of Dernbach and runs past him for one
low full toss, McCullum heaves it over midwicket, between two men but they manage to cut it off
full and straight, doesn't quite get the yorker right and McCullum clatters it back over Dernbach's head, it beats mid-off and scampers away for another boundary
out the back of the hand, McCullum was about to unleash the cavalry but had to rethink, waiting to dab through the covers
ratchets up the speed now, bangs it in short and the ball fizzes through past Elliott's nose

bowled him, a slowy just nudges the off bail! Even Dernbach was duped by that one, turning away in disappointment as Elliott pushed forward and was beaten ... but the magic had worked and that's another wicket, and another important dot ball
short and at the man, pulled through midwicket but flat and only for a single
goes back and steers a short-of-a-length ball through backward point to get McCullum back on strike
there she blows, a much-needed maximum for NZ, McCullum pulling ferociously over deep square leg, quite a flat hit but it was always going to clear the man - not a bad way to go to fifty
and again, that's even bigger (ie. would have been six on a normal ground too)! Broad went short again and McCullum carted the ball over deep backward square
full and straight, drifting towards leg stump but well dug out into the leg side and they get back for a second
it's not quite the number of the beast but McCullum smites his third six in four balls, stepping away and slicing a full, wide ball all the way over extra-cover
pitched up on leg stump, steps away and squirts one into the off side
touch short and pulled flat down the ground
slower ball, wide of the stumps, Franklin steps away and misses but McCullum was quick off the mark and gets a bye despite Buttler hitting the stumps

doesn't get his length right here, trying to get the yorker in but it comes out as a low full toss and McCullum disdainfully bunts it through extra-cover. Dernbach hops on his toes like a kid being told he can't go on the bouncy castle
and now he'll be hopping in anger, a slow, leg-side wide bobbling through Buttler's legs and running away for a bonus four!

short of a good length and outside off, swatted high into the off side... and taken! McCullum goes but not before stamping his mark on the match, dying by the sword that has taken a good few chunks out of England today
and slapped away for four more! It was full and wide, Franklin flung his wrists at it and managed to squeeze the ball past the dive of the man at point
